trans-unit.source: Put Page
trans-unit.target: Put Page

trans-unit.source: Put Page
trans-unit.target: Put Page

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation writes a range of pages to a page blob.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation writes a range of pages to a page blob.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service URI

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Either <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> is required.
trans-unit.target: Either <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> is required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the range of bytes to be written as a page.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the range of bytes to be written as a page.

trans-unit.source: Both the start and end of the range must be specified.
trans-unit.target: Both the start and end of the range must be specified.

trans-unit.source: This header is defined by the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This header is defined by the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For a page update operation, the page range can be up to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: For a page update operation, the page range can be up to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: For a page clear operation, the page range can be up to the value of the blob's full size.
trans-unit.target: For a page clear operation, the page range can be up to the value of the blob's full size.

trans-unit.source: Given that pages must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries, the start offset must be a modulus of 512 and the end offset must be a modulus of 512 – 1.
trans-unit.target: Given that pages must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries, the start offset must be a modulus of 512 and the end offset must be a modulus of 512 – 1.

trans-unit.source: Examples of valid byte ranges are 0-511, 512-1023, etc.
trans-unit.target: Examples of valid byte ranges are 0-511, 512-1023, etc.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service accepts only a single byte range for the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, and the byte range must be specified in the following format: <parameterReference>bytes=startByte-endByte</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service accepts only a single byte range for the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, and the byte range must be specified in the following format: <parameterReference>bytes=startByte-endByte</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8087cabc-5e40-4def-8790-a97a20448946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for Blob Service Operations</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8087cabc-5e40-4def-8790-a97a20448946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for Blob Service Operations</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Either <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> is required.
trans-unit.target: Either <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> is required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the range of bytes to be written as a page.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the range of bytes to be written as a page.

trans-unit.source: Both the start and end of the range must be specified.
trans-unit.target: Both the start and end of the range must be specified.

trans-unit.source: This header is defined by the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This header is defined by the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For a page update operation, the page range can be up to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: For a page update operation, the page range can be up to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: For a page clear operation, the page range can be up to the value of the blob's full size.
trans-unit.target: For a page clear operation, the page range can be up to the value of the blob's full size.

trans-unit.source: Given that pages must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries, the start offset must be a modulus of 512 and the end offset must be a modulus of 512 – 1.
trans-unit.target: Given that pages must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries, the start offset must be a modulus of 512 and the end offset must be a modulus of 512 – 1.

trans-unit.source: Examples of valid byte ranges are 0-511, 512-1023, etc.
trans-unit.target: Examples of valid byte ranges are 0-511, 512-1023, etc.

trans-unit.source: The Blob service accepts only a single byte range for the <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> header, and the byte range must be specified in the following format: <parameterReference>bytes=startByte-endByte</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service accepts only a single byte range for the <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> header, and the byte range must be specified in the following format: <parameterReference>bytes=startByte-endByte</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8087cabc-5e40-4def-8790-a97a20448946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for Blob Service Operations</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8087cabc-5e40-4def-8790-a97a20448946" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for Blob Service Operations</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of bytes being transmitted in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of bytes being transmitted in the request body.

trans-unit.source: When the <parameterReference>x-ms-page-write</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>clear</parameterReference>, the value of this header must be set to zero.
trans-unit.target: When the <parameterReference>x-ms-page-write</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>clear</parameterReference>, the value of this header must be set to zero.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An MD5 hash of the page content.
trans-unit.target: An MD5 hash of the page content.

trans-unit.source: This hash is used to verify the integrity of the page during transport.
trans-unit.target: This hash is used to verify the integrity of the page during transport.

trans-unit.source: When this header is specified, the storage service compares the hash of the content that has arrived with the header value that was sent.
trans-unit.target: When this header is specified, the storage service compares the hash of the content that has arrived with the header value that was sent.

trans-unit.source: If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>Content-MD5</parameterReference> header is not permitted when the <parameterReference>x-ms-page-write</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>clear</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>Content-MD5</parameterReference> header is not permitted when the <parameterReference>x-ms-page-write</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>clear</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If it is included with the request, the Blob service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If it is included with the request, the Blob service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: You may specify one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: You may specify one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Update</parameterReference>: Writes the bytes specified by the request body into the specified range.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Update</parameterReference>: Writes the bytes specified by the request body into the specified range.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> headers must match to perform the update.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> headers must match to perform the update.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Clear</parameterReference>: Clears the specified range and releases the space used in storage for that range.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Clear</parameterReference>: Clears the specified range and releases the space used in storage for that range.

trans-unit.source: To clear a range, set the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header to zero, and the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header to a value that indicates the range to clear, up to maximum blob size.
trans-unit.target: To clear a range, set the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header to zero, and the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header to a value that indicates the range to clear, up to maximum blob size.

trans-unit.source: Required if the blob has an active lease.
trans-unit.target: Required if the blob has an active lease.

trans-unit.source: To perform this operation on a blob with an active lease, specify the valid lease ID for this header.
trans-unit.target: To perform this operation on a blob with an active lease, specify the valid lease ID for this header.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: If the blob’s sequence number is less than or equal to the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with the SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the blob’s sequence number is less than or equal to the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with the SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: If the blob’s sequence number is less than the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the blob’s sequence number is less than the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: If the blob’s sequence number is equal to the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the blob’s sequence number is equal to the specified value, the request proceeds; otherwise it fails with SequenceNumberConditionNotMet error (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to write the page only if the blob has been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to write the page only if the blob has been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the blob has not been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this conditional header to write the page only if the blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this conditional header to write the page only if the blob has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: If the blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the blob has been modified, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to write the page only if the blob's ETag value matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to write the page only if the blob's ETag value matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the values do not match, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to write the page only if the blob's ETag value does not match the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify an ETag value for this conditional header to write the page only if the blob's ETag value does not match the value specified.

trans-unit.source: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the values are identical, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.
trans-unit.target: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="36087161-9e7c-47e4-904c-3392cc35a8e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="36087161-9e7c-47e4-904c-3392cc35a8e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: The request body contains the content of the page.
trans-unit.target: The request body contains the content of the page.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The ETag for the blob.
trans-unit.target: The ETag for the blob.

trans-unit.source: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.
trans-unit.target: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

trans-unit.source: The ETag can be used to perform a conditional <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation by specifying its value for the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: The ETag can be used to perform a conditional <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation by specifying its value for the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: The date and time that the blob was last modified.
trans-unit.target: The date and time that the blob was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The date format follows RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date format follows RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Any write operation on the blob, including updates to the blob’s metadata or properties, changes the last modified time of the blob.
trans-unit.target: Any write operation on the blob, including updates to the blob’s metadata or properties, changes the last modified time of the blob.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value as may have been specified in the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value as may have been specified in the request headers.

trans-unit.source: The current sequence number for the page blob.
trans-unit.target: The current sequence number for the page blob.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: This operation can be called by the account owner and by anyone with a Shared Access Signature that has permission to write to this blob or its container.
trans-unit.target: This operation can be called by the account owner and by anyone with a Shared Access Signature that has permission to write to this blob or its container.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation writes a range of pages to a page blob.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation writes a range of pages to a page blob.

trans-unit.source: This operation can only be called on an existing page blob.
trans-unit.target: This operation can only be called on an existing page blob.

trans-unit.source: It cannot be called to create a new page blob, nor can it be called on a block blob.
trans-unit.target: It cannot be called to create a new page blob, nor can it be called on a block blob.

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with a blob name that does not currently exist returns the BlobNotFound error (HTTP status code 404 – Not Found).
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with a blob name that does not currently exist returns the BlobNotFound error (HTTP status code 404 – Not Found).

trans-unit.source: To create a new page blob, call <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> and specify the type of blob to create as a page blob.
trans-unit.target: To create a new page blob, call <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> and specify the type of blob to create as a page blob.

trans-unit.source: A page blob may be up to 1 TB in size.
trans-unit.target: A page blob may be up to 1 TB in size.

trans-unit.source: If the blob has an active lease, the client must specify a valid lease ID on the request in order to write a page.
trans-unit.target: If the blob has an active lease, the client must specify a valid lease ID on the request in order to write a page.

trans-unit.source: Page Update Operations
trans-unit.target: Page Update Operations

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>Update</parameterReference> option performs an in-place write on the specified page blob.
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>Update</parameterReference> option performs an in-place write on the specified page blob.

trans-unit.source: Any content in the specified page is overwritten with the update.
trans-unit.target: Any content in the specified page is overwritten with the update.

trans-unit.source: If the server times out or your connection is closed during a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, the page may or may not have been updated.
trans-unit.target: If the server times out or your connection is closed during a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, the page may or may not have been updated.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you should continue to retry the update until you receive a response indicating success.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you should continue to retry the update until you receive a response indicating success.

trans-unit.source: Each range of pages submitted with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> for an update operation may be up to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: Each range of pages submitted with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> for an update operation may be up to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: The start and end range of the page must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries.
trans-unit.target: The start and end range of the page must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to upload a range of pages that is larger than 4MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large).
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to upload a range of pages that is larger than 4MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large).

trans-unit.source: Page Clear Operations
trans-unit.target: Page Clear Operations

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>Clear</parameterReference> option releases the storage space used by the specified page.
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>Clear</parameterReference> option releases the storage space used by the specified page.

trans-unit.source: Pages that have been cleared are no longer tracked as part of the page blob.
trans-unit.target: Pages that have been cleared are no longer tracked as part of the page blob.

trans-unit.source: Pages that have been cleared no longer incur a charge against the storage account, as their storage resources have been released.
trans-unit.target: Pages that have been cleared no longer incur a charge against the storage account, as their storage resources have been released.

trans-unit.source: The only exception to this is if there are existing snapshots of the page blob; pages in snapshots incur a charge if those same pages no longer exist as part of the source blob.
trans-unit.target: The only exception to this is if there are existing snapshots of the page blob; pages in snapshots incur a charge if those same pages no longer exist as part of the source blob.

trans-unit.source: Managing Concurrency Issues
trans-unit.target: Managing Concurrency Issues

trans-unit.source: The Blob service handles concurrent writes to overlapping pages sequentially: the last page processed by the service determines the blob's content.
trans-unit.target: The Blob service handles concurrent writes to overlapping pages sequentially: the last page processed by the service determines the blob's content.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, to ensure the integrity of the blob's content, the client should handle writes to overlapping pages using one or more of the following approaches:
trans-unit.target: Therefore, to ensure the integrity of the blob's content, the client should handle writes to overlapping pages using one or more of the following approaches:

trans-unit.source: You can check the value of the <parameterReference>Last-Modified</parameterReference> response header for each successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: You can check the value of the <parameterReference>Last-Modified</parameterReference> response header for each successful call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The order of responses returned from the Blob service does not necessarily correspond to the order in which they were executed by the service.
trans-unit.target: The order of responses returned from the Blob service does not necessarily correspond to the order in which they were executed by the service.

trans-unit.source: But the value of <parameterReference>Last-Modified</parameterReference> always indicates the order in which the service processed the requests.
trans-unit.target: But the value of <parameterReference>Last-Modified</parameterReference> always indicates the order in which the service processed the requests.

trans-unit.source: You can perform updates conditionally based on the blob's ETag or last modified time using optimistic concurrency.
trans-unit.target: You can perform updates conditionally based on the blob's ETag or last modified time using optimistic concurrency.

trans-unit.source: This approach works well if the number of concurrent writes is relatively low.
trans-unit.target: This approach works well if the number of concurrent writes is relatively low.

trans-unit.source: Use the conditional request headers <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> for this purpose.
trans-unit.target: Use the conditional request headers <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> for this purpose.

trans-unit.source: You can call <link xlink:href="68b74877-5678-46c1-bdbf-f6a68a73f75b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Lease Blob</link> to lock the blob against other writes for a one-minute period, or longer if the lease is renewed.
trans-unit.target: You can call <link xlink:href="68b74877-5678-46c1-bdbf-f6a68a73f75b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Lease Blob</link> to lock the blob against other writes for a one-minute period, or longer if the lease is renewed.

trans-unit.source: You can use the blob's sequence number to ensure that retrying a request for which there was no response does not result in concurrent updates.
trans-unit.target: You can use the blob's sequence number to ensure that retrying a request for which there was no response does not result in concurrent updates.

trans-unit.source: This approach may be best for clients requiring high throughput for page writes.
trans-unit.target: This approach may be best for clients requiring high throughput for page writes.

trans-unit.source: It is described in detail in the following section.
trans-unit.target: It is described in detail in the following section.

trans-unit.source: Using the Page Blob Sequence Number to Retry Requests
trans-unit.target: Using the Page Blob Sequence Number to Retry Requests

trans-unit.source: When a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> times out or does not return a response, there is no way to know for certain whether the request succeeded.
trans-unit.target: When a call to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> times out or does not return a response, there is no way to know for certain whether the request succeeded.

trans-unit.source: You therefore need to retry the request, but due to the distributed nature of the Azure storage services, it is possible that the original request may be processed after the retried request has succeeded.
trans-unit.target: You therefore need to retry the request, but due to the distributed nature of the Azure storage services, it is possible that the original request may be processed after the retried request has succeeded.

trans-unit.source: The delayed original request can overwrite other updates and yield an unexpected result.
trans-unit.target: The delayed original request can overwrite other updates and yield an unexpected result.

trans-unit.source: The following sequence illustrates how this may happen:
trans-unit.target: The following sequence illustrates how this may happen:

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request to write value "X" to page 0 times out or does not return a response.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request to write value "X" to page 0 times out or does not return a response.

trans-unit.source: A retried request to write value "X" to page 0 succeeds.
trans-unit.target: A retried request to write value "X" to page 0 succeeds.

trans-unit.source: A request to write value "Y" to page 0 succeeds.
trans-unit.target: A request to write value "Y" to page 0 succeeds.

trans-unit.source: The original request succeeds, writing value "X" to page 0.
trans-unit.target: The original request succeeds, writing value "X" to page 0.

trans-unit.source: Reading page 0 returns value "X", when the client was at this point expecting value "Y".
trans-unit.target: Reading page 0 returns value "X", when the client was at this point expecting value "Y".

trans-unit.source: This kind of conflict can occur when the original request does not return a status code between 100-499, or 503 (Server Busy).
trans-unit.target: This kind of conflict can occur when the original request does not return a status code between 100-499, or 503 (Server Busy).

trans-unit.source: If one of these status codes is returned, you can be certain as to whether the request has succeeded or failed.
trans-unit.target: If one of these status codes is returned, you can be certain as to whether the request has succeeded or failed.

trans-unit.source: But if the service returns a status code outside this range, there's no way to know the status of the original request.
trans-unit.target: But if the service returns a status code outside this range, there's no way to know the status of the original request.

trans-unit.source: To prevent this sort of conflict, you can use the page blob's sequence number to ensure that when you retry a request, the original request will not subsequently succeed.
trans-unit.target: To prevent this sort of conflict, you can use the page blob's sequence number to ensure that when you retry a request, the original request will not subsequently succeed.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you should increment the sequence number before retrying the original request.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you should increment the sequence number before retrying the original request.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the conditional sequence number headers to ensure that the request fails if its sequence number does not match the expected sequence number.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the conditional sequence number headers to ensure that the request fails if its sequence number does not match the expected sequence number.

trans-unit.source: The following sequence illustrates this approach:
trans-unit.target: The following sequence illustrates this approach:

trans-unit.source: The client creates a page blob with <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> and sets its sequence number to 0.
trans-unit.target: The client creates a page blob with <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> and sets its sequence number to 0.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request to write value "X" to page 0 with the <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> header set to <userInput>1</userInput> times out or does not return a response.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Page</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request to write value "X" to page 0 with the <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> header set to <userInput>1</userInput> times out or does not return a response.

trans-unit.source: The client calls Set Blob Properties to update the sequence number to 1.
trans-unit.target: The client calls Set Blob Properties to update the sequence number to 1.

trans-unit.source: A retried request to write value "X" to page 0 with <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> set to <userInput>2</userInput> succeeds.
trans-unit.target: A retried request to write value "X" to page 0 with <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> set to <userInput>2</userInput> succeeds.

trans-unit.source: A request to write value "Y" to page 0 with <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> set to <userInput>2</userInput> succeeds.
trans-unit.target: A request to write value "Y" to page 0 with <parameterReference>if-sequence-number-lt</parameterReference> set to <userInput>2</userInput> succeeds.

trans-unit.source: The original request is finally processed, but it fails because it specifies the condition that the sequence number must be less than 1 (that is, the <parameterReference>if-sequence-num-lt</parameterReference> header is set to <userInput>1</userInput>).
trans-unit.target: The original request is finally processed, but it fails because it specifies the condition that the sequence number must be less than 1 (that is, the <parameterReference>if-sequence-num-lt</parameterReference> header is set to <userInput>1</userInput>).

trans-unit.source: The error is SequenceNumberConditionNotMet (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: The error is SequenceNumberConditionNotMet (HTTP status code 412 – Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: Reading page 0 returns the expected value of "Y".
trans-unit.target: Reading page 0 returns the expected value of "Y".
